caption: I tried this place once with my friend and I am addicted ever since. I liked the good vibes and delicious dishes and beverages. Kudos.

I visit this special restaurant from time to time because I enjoy the special air that is exist in this restaurant. The personel is extraordianrillyremarkably attentive and professional. The service is awfully quick. Most important, the food they prepare is excellent. I have been there more than once and I was never disappointed. The pay is fair. I highly suggest this place to my friends and family.

We enjoy hanging out. Last night we came to this fine restaurant which friends told us about. We enjoyed a beautiful evening there with high-qulity meal and a professional team and a talented chief cook. We  added this restaurant in our list  and we will surely visit again soon. We warmly recommend.
One of my fav spots for quality Pizza. visited fri evening i think. there was fast and courteous service.

The food here was good and staff friendly. Located very central in downtown Atlanta and convenient. We found it to be more of a bar than restaurant but it was very good and also quite small which was nice. A small place, nice and quiet. Menu of pizzas, salads and sandwiches. I have the Reuben with Turkey which was very good came with a pickle and bag of chips. Small bar with a limited beers selection. Great place for a quick meal.
Tried this spot in the past with a friend and I am hooked since then. I love the good mood and delightful dishes and drinks. I recommend this place.
The atmosphere is outstanding, the customer service is great, and the food was amazing. I definitely recommend them to everyone I know!

This place is off the beaten path but has a nice vibe. The pizza was good along with the lasagna. They also have a good selection of local beers. Wait staff was also friendly. We’ve come here several times on other trips to Atlanta and have never been disappointed. Love the lasagna, pizza, and salads. Wait staff very friendly and engaging. Very different place in Downtown ATL.

Overall, the pizza was delicious and filling. The crust was not too thin and not too thick, and perfectly cooked. The sauce tasted unique although I prefer a bit more spice in my sauce. Good and efficient service too

One of the best spinach salads I have ever had. And I could drown myself in the honey mustard dressing. It is hands down the best honey mustard I've ever had (made in-house, I'm told)! The pizza is delish, and I can't wait to try some of the other menu items because they all look amazing. The vibe is super down-to-earth and the service is impeccable! Our waiter was incredible - super friendly, knowledgable and just fun. And the owner (or manager) couldn't be nicer. I highly recommend this gem!

I absolutely love coming here! The service is outstanding and Daniel aka “Chico” is always welcoming and prompt! I have been traveling back and fourth for work the last 6 months and have become a regular! Always enjoy the meal regardless of what I choose and I highly recommend the Chico suave bread and the watermelon Gin special! Also love the home made meat balls, yum! Big shout outs to Jed and Jade, their service is stellar and they always are welcoming! Jed even went as far as letting me know what places to try when I head to st Pete for a condense this May! The only thing that I would say that drives me nuts is the light above their bar that has been out for nearly 4 months.... owners should really take pride as they have an amazing team but need to take care of their business! They are lucky to have such great team members and I hope all 3 of them will be recognized!
great food, better people, fast service. awesome beer list, too
Drinks so strong I couldn’t finish one. That’s a good thing. Pizza huge, hot and delicious
Doughey and cheesey. Cheese bread was fabulous.The best drunk pizza.
An out of the way pizza joint with my favorite Stromboli.
Delicious food with a grungy atmosphere and friendly service.
Great place, great pizza’s, great prices.
Great food and fast service
Tasty pizza 🍕 Full bar! Service was great. Nice & cozy atmosphere.
Amazing pizza and really good service.
Cool space, great service, excellent pizza, and good beer selection.
Most definitely. It was sooooo good.
Overall the meat lovers pizza was delicious. Staff was friendly. Have some local beers there too, didn't try, had to go back to work. Would go again.

Was greeted immediately once we walked in by the host. Order drinks were taking with in a few minutes. The food i ordered was great. I had the greek salad and lasagna. They both were really good. I would recommend this place. Nice clean atmosphere, great staff and service.
Cool bar, good atmosphere and lovely beer/pizza - what more could you ask for 🙂
The cooking is very good, the workers are professional
Great Place.  Stumbled upon it before the peach bowl.  Great service. Great bar. Clean bathrooms Pizza was scrumptious  Highly recommend before dome sporting events.
Great staff. Great food. Thank you
Great pizza and lasagna.  Also try the Chico Suave!
Mid day lunch. Not real busy had great service and the food was excellent.
Great meatballs! Great service!

I had a coffee here and took up a few tables playing chess with a few friends. Waitstaff was a bit rude, I thought it was ok what with the space we were taking up, although it wasnt crowded. I left a debit card and motioned for us to leave. I was a college student and broke or I would've spent more.  What wasn't ok was when they took my credit card numbers. As it was a debit account I lost my rent money. Working on bank to recover but they refuse to investigate Slice. I KNOW who did it. I will turn this over to the proper authorities.
Best pizza ever...
I love coming here before and sometimes after work. The environment is nice, the service is fantastic and the food is so good. Best pizza in Atlanta in my opinion.
Good atmosphere, good pizza
Great wait staff.  Great atmosphere.   Pizza, AMAZING!!  This was a great find.
Birthdays and coworkers
Beer was good pizza fresh nice atmosphere

Good food, chill atmosphere, great service. We had a few beers, the cheese stix appetizer and a white pizza. The appetizer was different and downright tasty. Marinara was really good, not what I expected outside of the northeast US. Pizza is really more New Haven style than New York with a really crispy, thin crust and charred, buttery edges. The waitress was nice and brought drinks over quick. Only reservation is location- it seemed kind of isolated but is totally worth it if you're comfortable with the area.
Solid pizza, but wow is it slow!  Kitchen had a hard time putting out food.  Front staff was excellent and made things right.
Loved the food and loved the environment! If we visit Georgia again will definitely try again!

Real nice modern bar / eatery. I only went for a slice of pizza and it was nice and tasted good. I noticed they have a charging station built into their counter top which is a cool addition making it good for guests and also offering free wifi is a big bonus! The pizza is great and so is the atmosphere because Slice has large picture windows that let you see what is happening outside.

We found this place by scanning Google Maps. It's really out of the way, kind of got a Hidden Gem vibe. Pizza was fantastic, prices are very fair. Our server was fantastic, and the place had a Cool vibe. Even my picky four-year-old enjoyed the pizza. I had a slice of sweet pea which was really amazing, I also had some Hawaiian Barbecue which was absolutely fantastic. The sweet tea taste like weird syrup though, it wasn't real brewed tea, so I just ordered something different. Will definitely visit again when in the city.

Good vibe. Everyone is friendly. The guy running the bar is super attentive and nice. Had the pesto Pollo pizza and it was pretty darn good. Prices are good too. Slices run $4.75 to 6ish and draught beers 4 to 7. Pretty happy I wandered in while waiting for a show.
A cozy and down to earth place for food and drink! The regulars are friendly. The staff is attentive and excellent.  Real New York Pizza (and calzones too!)
Pizza was pretty decent tho adding a premium topping for hefty add on, was pretty sparse.

Ok 1st time to atl ..was 4 a concert ..we were on a budget n went to slice..they brought out a burt black crusty pizza...but the noticed n made it right n gave us free food they are awesome ..thought o no but.. they MADE IT GOOD  awesome place to eat pizza was awesome n salad
The food was great and the staff was very nice. There was some confusion with our order but they were very nice about fixing it, it just took awhile to get it sorted.
Great spot to drop in and have a beer. Their cheese sticks are amazing and a half order is a whole lot for only five bucks!
Good pizza
Great food and a good staff
Everything was delicious
Great pizza place in a quiet corner. Good pizza
Good food, friendly but genuine staff, cool atmosphere. Loaded baked potato pizza was well balanced and the house-made ceaser dressing is excellent.

My partner and I decided to stop here a few weeks ago while on our annual summer trip. We looked up "good pizza spots" and this was one of the first places that came up. It is located on a very hidden street, we actually got lost a few times while trying to get there. HA! We picked out our seats, as this is a seat yourself restaurant, and were greeted by our server. Carolina was excellent! She had such a cheery disposition and answered all of our questions about the menu. Our drinks were also very delicious. Overall this place was fantastic. We enjoyed both our food, service, and atmosphere. There was just one flaw that we found. We think that the owner should consider putting a curtain where the kitchen opening is. From where we were sitting, we could hear some not so nice comments being made by one of the chefs. We could hear them discussing a certain order, which we believed to be our own. This is not exactly something you want to hear on your night out. We did not want to bring this up to our server, as we did not want to worry her. The food was delicious and we would consider dining here again, we are just a little hesitant.  -LH
Best pizza EVER
Nice place and food good
Not sure why they're called slice. It was probably the worst pizza I've ever had but the sandwiches were phenomenal!
Fun place great food and service
I swing after work to grab a quick pbr and the vibe and staff are always 100% on point. Ive had the pizza twice and it is also stellar.
Had a stromboli today with my wife it was awesome! Definitely going back for more before we leave Atlanta.
For the price, I expected better. But it was convenient.
If you don’t wanna wait a long line to get a slice of pizza, come here.
We love this place before ATL UTD games. Take the Marta to Little Five and 2 blocks away. A hidden gem. Awesome pizza, good selection of beer and always super friendly staff!
Good food lovely workers it was just lovely
The service was excellent and the pizza is amazing
Service horrible food not worth ptice
Tucked away in the backstreets. I like it.
Best place to grab a slice and a beer in between classes for students. The staff is very friendly. The owner John is very down to earth and ensures all customers have a great experience.
This is one of my favorite pizza places in Atlanta. Great atmosphere and delicious food!
Pizza is really good! No complaints here.
First time eating at this off the beaten path establishment. Wonderful wait staff and wonderful pizza. The crust was crispy and flavorful.
Service was bad , took 46 mins to get a slice of pizza and there were 0 people in restaurant.
Food was on point
Hint: it's called Slice for a reason. Order by the slice. Seems to give you more bang for your buck then getting a whole medium pizza.
Cozy decor and I love the feel of the place. Super friendly staff servers and bartenders, even the cooks! Great beer selection and good food. Great place to meet friends and chill.
I heard great reviews about it but service wants good. I think there were only 2 people who served and the place was crowded so they couldn't appropriately cover everyone.

After a random and unexpected trip to Atlanta from Pensacola we decided to stop for a bite before the return trip home.... Let me tell you I dont regret it! Food was fantastic and fresh, the music was great and the atmosphere was perfect.... It's on a short list of places to visit next time I'm In Atlanta.... Thanks guys!

The Pizza was delish, We had the Bianca, and a Greek Salad. The service this was awful. We came during a week night, you're supposed to seat yourself however a server never came to our table. I had to go to the bar to place our order. The bartender (tall, African Black Guy w/ Locs, he was super nice by the way) said he'd send a server to us. Our server finally came, took the order, the food came out very fast however we never received our beers. My boyfriend went to the bar this time to get out drinks from the bartender. We basically served ourselves that night. The server can back and apologized, saying she put the drink order in but the bartender never received it 🤔  My boyfriend goes there a lot and said the same thing happened to him on a previous visit. I'd stick to Take Out or just visit a place that has more attentive servers. Other than than the Pizza was great.
Amazing Hawaiian pizza
You want some delicious pizza slice is it. I love the sweet pea pizza. It has huge artichokes.
Great drinks
Food was good! Service was friendly. Decently priced
Perfect slice of pizza.  From Garlic butter on the crust to just enough sauce and cheese to get good flavor and having  enough toppings that you get some with every bite. Delicious!  Will be back.
Waiters quite attentive, pizzas and salads were good. There wasnt any other kid than mine
Enjoyed the Spaghetti and Meatballs while on Vacation.
The crispest, most flavorful this crust I've had at any pizza joint in Atlanta.  My secret place for great pizza.

This was my first visit to Slice Downtown. Cozy environment with friendly service. Food was outstanding! We started off with the cheese sticks which were awesome. The order in the picture is a small order. Then we ordered a large half margherita and half veggie lovers pizza. Both types were very good, but my favorite was the veggie lovers. Their crust is delicious. One person in our party ordered the veggie lasagna, which is not pictured. She was very satisfied with her order as well. We will definitely be back when we are back in town.
Pizza slices are crispy and delicious. The loaded baked potato flavor pizza slice was awesome.
Quaint place with good pizza

The pizza was solid the hard cider I had was delicious and our server was great.  The first table we sat at before we moved to a different area had a hot mess server so I'd say the service is iffy.  Definitely a cool vibe in the space.
Chico the bartender is the best
Friendly

Terrible... Waste of my $14...had the Pesto Pollo, it was soggy. Too much Pesto so the bottom of the pizza didn't crisp. The chicken was bland. I just ate the back end of the slice, it was the only crisp part. I have a slice of Supreme but I probably will not even eat it.

The flavor of the pizza was amazing but the crust was uneven and the toppings were center loaded with “bloody edges” (my husband’s description).  Needless to say this pizza should not have made it to the table. Parts of the crust were underdone while other parts were burnt. It was a slow Saturday evening and there was 3 other parties in there. Mind you I had my two young children with me. I feel like maybe our pizza was made badly to discourage us from coming back. This place had no high chairs so I got the hint real quickly that they preferred not to be kid friendly.  My waitress was over attentive at the start and then mostly ignored us once our pizza arrived. That was fine by me because she honestly made me very uncomfortable when she hovered initially. I did go ahead and tip her the full 25% because she did bring my food and drinks promptly. Although I had to wave her down for my bill. While the price of the pizza was reasonable for this kind of place, I felt $8 for a bottle of beer was too much.  Maybe it has been too long since I ordered a bottle of beer while out because I typically drink draft.  I was really hoping that I would love this place. I am down in that part of town several times a year for conventions.  The owner wants to talk about my child wandering the restaurant. She spent most of the time on the couch by the door and then wander over to check out an arcade machine shoved up in the corner. There were no customers really besides us in the restaurant and I’m surprised the staff even noticed my daughter go over to the arcade since they were too busy socializing and eating at the bar. The owner only wishes to make it seem like my review should not be taken seriously but his response only further proves the attitude of him and his staff. He doesn’t even say anything to the description of the pizza or the photo of the pizza.
Stopped in for a work lunch and found my new meeting place! Try the esmerelda dressing.
filled me up in no time. the service was very sociable and kind. kinda of like a place in houston that i enjoyed.
Good pizza and beer selection, service was great
First time dining in Slice Downtown The ambience is on point here I'm not a big steak lover but the oysters and the sides are to die for!!!
Delicious pizza! Small place, good service.
Great pizza. Love the order by the slice. But the whole pizzas are great also. Good beer and ok wine selection. Very modern feel and friendly staff.
This place was just my kind of place...good portions, good beers and great service at the bar. Wish I had time to try a few more of the drafts.. next time.
Delicious pizza...get the baked potato pizza

Had the Lasagna and meatballs. They were HORRIBLE. However, I have had the pizza before and it's usually good. If I ever come back, I'll only order pizza. The meatballs were super hard and the mint leaves threw the entire flavor off. The lasagna was also hard and disgusting. I'm not sure if I just came at a bad time but it was horrible.
As the only black man in there I was basically invisible and had to yell to obtain any sort of service. I have no information on the food cause I refuse to eat here. It's just not for us*
Excellent slices of pizza! Love the thin butter crust.

Really nice and chill atmosphere. Kat our Bartender was awesome. She made an excellent Magarita and was both friendly and attentive. We ordered the Muffaletta Sandwich , a caesar salad and built our own slices. The Food was great. We'll be back for sure.
I really liked the marinata sauce. Friendly and fast  service.

The pizza was great and it came out quickly.  I arrived very close to closing time so I was a little worried how things would turn out.  They were very nice and did not act upset that I arrived so late so I guess my fears were unwarranted.  I do wish they stayed open a little later, but their closing times were inline with most restaurant's downtown. I will definately go back next time I am in the area.

So relaxing and easy to chill with a Groupon for stellar white pizza and great beer menu We loved the exposed brick concrete counters and relaxed benches and sofa decor The same exact replica of this restaurant would work anywhere small town or big  True hangout vibe for drinks or dinner for regulars or strangers like us  So cozy, cool and easy on the wallet
Good pizza for the price. I've been here twice now, and I don't have any complaints.
Great lunch!
Good pizza downtown
Great staff, strong drinks and good pizza what more do you need!?
This hidden jewel downtown has some of the best pizza I've had. The prices are great and the service is never lacking.

Great Vegetarian Lasagna!!! I was hooked until I became Vegan. It’s in a nice small venue near GSU campus. It has a full bar and has very soothing atmosphere. They serve pizza and have professional bar tenders/Mixologiston staff.
Nice find. Pizza and beer joint near downtown. Arugula salad was good, can’t go wrong with Pizza and Beer. Service was quick and informal. Would go back
Everything a person wants: large portions and cheap price. Amazing. So far, the best restaurant I visited during my stay at Atlanta.
great food
Great sandwich. I had the Italian. Lightly toasted with fresh lettuce tomatoes and onion. Staff was very pleasent as well
Casual atmosphere, cold beer, and great pizza! The lady running the place was awesome.

Excellent service and food. Laid back atmosphere with couches. I had the pesto pollo pizza and it was timely and cooked to perfection. I am visiting Atlanta but would certainly come back.  They have their act together.
Great pizza
Real chill spot. Yummy pizza! I like 😍😍😍
Went there on through the Ritual App. I loved the service and the food was really Great.I’m going back definitely!
Huge slices of pizza and stylish atmosphere.
Perfect place. Good food good musoc and good beer !
Very good pizza, close to the Tabernacle
the pizza is really good quality and I even ended up eating the crust which i normally hate.
Very good
I had the veggie lasagna this time, it was pretty good. Next time I'll try something else.. nice spot though
Fantastic - warm friendly inviting atmosphere.

Called in to order pizza, and after the phone ringing for over a minute then being placed on hold for 3 minutes...I hung up. Called back and got my order in for pickup. Went to get the order and the server acted like they didn't know what pickup was when I said I'm here to pick up my order. Also, snobby attitude. Pizza taste not so good. Crust is not tasty... And what is the weird tasting stuff that is brushed on the crust. Priced too high for the quality. Not interested in eating the pizzas again . Also, no parking. And the sausage very salty. Also, half sausage does not mean 3 out of 8 slices . And that bunch of sauce at the top of my pizza is not a good look.
Worst pizza ever!
Nice and relaxing atmosphere. I recommend the muffaletta sandwich; it is awesome. The bartender gets an A+.
I used to order Slice through UberEats for about a year before I moved. Best pizza in Atlanta for me. Their on-site location has slower service, but the food is excellent.
Nice staff. Pizza always hits the spot.  Pro tip: Get the honey mustard because it is great. On anything!
Pretty good

😁Me and my family stumbled upon this place on new year's. We was really trying to get home to beat that atlanta traffic🚗🚕🚛🚗 but they were hungry🤤. Soon as we walked in we got good energy from patrons to the staff. We were greeted and we sat down. Got our drinks and menus and said "let's just try things out! " It turned out to be well worth it. Everything was fresh and made to order. We enjoyed every morsel of our food for the time that we spent there. We paid our tab and tipped our waitress and headed home.
My girlfriend got a huge slice of a tasty BBQ pizza for just $5, and my stromboli was excellent!
Excellent lasagna
One of my go to spots. Tasty, big slices and not expensive.
It was amazing! Great breadsticks delicious spaghetti and the pizza was A+! Service was awesome! The owner was funny and friendly!  Definitely coming back when we return!

I have no idea how this company has such a high rating.  I ordered food from this place via Doordash and the pizza was absolutely horrible!!! It treated like it had been frozen at some point!!! There is no way they actually make their pizza from fresh ingredients when it literally tastes like i purchased a frozen pizza from the grocery store and popped it in the oven myself. Wow!!!  Note to owner: You guys should be embarrassed!!! You're obviously freezing your ingredients and it can be tasted  in the food! If that changes,  please let me know.  I'd love to try it again.
Awesome pizza and salad at a great price. Super friendly staff
This was a very nice local eatery. Good food, good service.
Loooove their bruschetta
Food was great! The service was also amazing! Caroline was great!
Great Pizza and pretty inexpensive.
Get the stromboli
Not very many options if you are gluten free, but the salad was very good.
Great pizza and cold beer.
Happy hour is the best. 2 for 1 drinks. Yaaasss

Everything a person wants: large portions and cheap price. Amazing. So far, the best restaurant I visited during my stay at Atlanta.  Food was incredibly good (a little spicy my spaghetti) but still amazing. The environment is modern-industrial and the staff is really polite.  Highly recommend this place for pizza, salads, pies and pasta.
It has really good pizza. Great pizzeria.
Great food
Best pizza in the area and a solid beer selection.  Two slices and a soda will only set you back about $10 at lunch.
Great bartender
Visiting Atlanta from Miami. Awesome place to stop by and eat from walking around downtown. Awesome staff and good food.
Good college bar and full of regulars/ locals mixed with people staying in nearby hotels for events. Nicest staff, good pizza, good drinks.

So sad, revisited after 6 years or so.  On the first visit we were so impressed with the food and the owner.  Obviously he has sold and it has gone downhill from there.  I had the Italian sandwich, bread overcooked and the lettuce and tomatoes so sad.  What a great shame.
Awesome time all the time
So good!
Good restaurant in Downtown Atlanta
Great calzones!
Visiting from Panama City Beach I had the calzone my husband and son had the stromboli and my daughter had pizza all was AMAZING!!! And our server was great too!! 8/23/18

Good pizza. Came In for just a couple of slices to go. Waited longer than expected but pizza was tastey. Atmosphere was relaxed and open. Servers seemed busy and maybe slightly aloof but it was fine for what we needed.
Excellent food. Pizza is phenomenal! I highly recommend that you stop by and have a slice!
Nice menu selection, Pizza was good and the staff was friendly

I was fortunate enough to grab one of the few Groupon's available for this little slice of pizza heaven!!! This was our first visit, and it will not be our last! From the aromatic and savory fresh made meatballs and garlic toast to the melt in your mouth creation of the Cordon Bleu calzone with tender chicken breast married to ham and fresh roma tomatoes all glue together with bleu cheese sauce in a buttery crust this is pure culinary genius. Be prepared to have your tongue do back flips as the Hawaiian BBQ takes you from the heart of downtown Atlanta to the sandy beaches of Waikiki. The staff, with their pleasant demeanor, makes sure your experience is perfectly enjoyable. Thank you for making our dining adventure one we look forward to repeating.

Honestly a great spot for an amazing atmosphere and even better food in downtown Atlanta. I would have never found this place if it wasn't for a Google search but I would recommend this to anyone visiting the area! I had the Caesar salad and just a simple cheese pizza but it was very good. I will be visiting here again when I come back to the area.
Delicious pizza!! Great atmosphere, and friendly bartenders! Nice vibe here! I’ll be back for more!!
Very thin crust with very little sauce.
I had better. It wasn't a pizza. It was more like a cheese cracker.
Pretty good, not great. Good for a quick bite with the kids.
Had the Italian  sub and it was AMAZING!  I  will be definitely coming back again.
(Translated by Google) excellent place, cheap and very good service, I aspire to return ...  (Original) excelente lugar, económico y la atención muy buena, aspiro volver...
My favorite pizza place for a good Slice 😉
Great pizza, great customer service and all in one of my favorite historical districts in Atlanta. Good location and price.

Best pizza, salad, sandwiches and drinks in Atlanta. The lasagna is very good as well. If you work or are visiting Downtown you must try this place. The food is always consistent and the service is always friendly. Great spot for concert or game meet ups. Also a happy hour favorite. I love the fact that this place has remained while other places in the are have seem to come and go. I've been frequenting this gem for over 10 years.
Pizza was alright. The staff was nice and the place seemed cool.
Excellent sauce and crust
Great pizza and servers.
This place rules school and has a fun inviting bar atmosphere with arcade games and TVs. Anytime I'm downtown I try and make it here.

One of the best spinach salads I have ever had. And I could drown myself in the honey mustard dressing. It is hands down the best honey mustard I've ever had (made in-house, I'm told)! The pizza is delish, and I can't wait to try some of the other menu items because they all look amazing. The vibe is super down-to-earth and the service is impeccable! Our waiter was incredible - super friendly, knowledgable and just fun. And the owner (or manager) couldn't be nicer. I highly recommend this gem!
Love the pizza, place and very accommodating staff
Just wasn't as flavorful as we had hoped. It's a good place to  have a quick bite out with friends before a night out. However the pizza was a bit bland.
This place is very nice and the atmosphere is laid back and homely. Friendly staff and great food.
Weekday early evening, wait not bad, good food,
Cozy atmosphere.  Good food.  Nice place to chill with friends.  Will have to wait for pizza to cook. .
Pizza good and restaurant had a pleasant atmosphere didn't want to go back to work will visit again
The Loaded Baked Potatoe Pizza SLICE 💯💯💯💯
Awesome
Great food and service. The baked potato pizza was amazing!
Delicious pizza in a nice atmosphere. Great place to sit and relax but not good if you want a quick bite.
This is my favorite pizza place in downtown Atlanta. Good thin crust pizza, good salads and sandwiches, good beer selection. Staff is friendly.
One of my favorite pizza joints
Had the stromboli. Very tasty; going back!
(Translated by Google) HELP  (Original) SALOMLAR
The place never disappoints. Four years in a row visiting here and the food and drinks are only surpassed by the excellent service.
Extremely disappointing,  went for lunch got 2 slices of pizza, they were like dried up cardboard! With NO cheese, they had to be from days before. Could not believe they would serve that!
The drinks are ok depending on bartenders. Havent eaten there yet tho
Excellent customer service. Food is tasty for the reasonable price.
A pizza fave!
I love this place!!
This is the best place to go before a show at the Tabernacle. It's never too busy and the pizza is delicious. Try the the Loaded Baked Potato pizza, it's my favorite.
That was delicious I had a salad from there
Good service and food. Prices are reasonable. Not overly crowded at lunch.
Pizza is awesome. Try the Stromboli!
I only went for a beer. They had Galaga so I love it.
Tasty pizza...
Best pizza in town!
one of my favorite places for a quick slice of really good homemade pizza
The meatballs are a killer and together with a basement I was sold. Really a down to earth place with very good food. Limited on tap beer though.

(Translated by Google) Excellent, healthy pizza eaten outside. Delightful !  We had spotted this charming restaurant the day before which is located not far from the Ferris wheel near the central park in a peaceful and very pleasant area. We finally went there last night July 4, 2015 for dinner. We were able to get a table outside. We are seated in a small, narrow street with no traffic where only a few pedestrians pass by from time to time. Romantic atmosphere par excellence. It seemed quite noisy inside to us but you might like this atmosphere depending on your tastes. We prefer calm in our case and have been delighted at this level. Christy T. was our server and was correct and very kind to us. We stopped our pick on a 12 inch 6 slice supreme pizza at $ 16.95. If you are very hungry, a larger 8 points may be suitable for you. An all dressed and well prepared style pizza that gave us great satisfaction. We invite you to take a look at our photos which will be published soon. The bill was $ 18.31 with tax. The people leaving the restaurant all had good comments and seemed happy with their visit. We recommend the restaurant and the pizza as we cannot speak for the other dishes.  Reviewed July 5, 2015 in Atlanta GA.  (Original) Excellente pizza santé dégustée à l’extérieur.  Exquis !  Nous avions repéré ce charmant restaurant la veille qui est situé non loin de la grande roue près du parc central dans un quartier paisible et fort agréable. Nous y sommes finalement allés hier soir le 4 juillet 2015 pour y souper. Nous avons pu avoir une table à l’extérieur.  Nous sommes assis dans une petite rue étroite sans circulation automobile où seulement quelques piétons passent près de nous de temps en temps.  Ambiance romantique par excellence.  Ça nous a semblé pas mal bruyant à l’intérieur mais cette atmosphère pourrait vous plaire tout dépendant de vos goûts.  Nous préférons le calme dans notre cas et avons été comblés à ce niveau. Christy T. était notre serveur et a été correct et fort aimable avec nous. Nous avons arrêté notre choix sur une pizza suprême 12 pouces de 6 pointes à $16.95.  Si vous avez très faim, une plus grande de 8 pointes saurait vous convenir. Une pizza de style toute garnie et bien apprêtée qui nous a donné grande satisfaction. Nous vous invitons à jeter un œil sur nos photos qui seront publiées prochainement. La facture s’éleva à $18.31 avec la taxe. Les gens qui sortaient du restaurant avaient tous de bons commentaires et semblaient satisfaits de leur visite. Nous recommandons le restaurant et la pizza car nous ne pouvons pas parler pour les autres plats.  Avis écrit le 5 juillet 2015 à Atlanta GA.
Stromboli was big and tasty. Reasonable  prices.
Amazing experience, great atmosphere, delicious food. They even gave my 3yr daughter some fresh dough to keep her busy.

Where all the cool locals hang out 🎈😊 one of my favorite spots downtown.

I stumbled upon this little gem purely by accident and I'm glad I did. The food is amazing and the staff is extremely friendly.
Cozy downtown pizza place even my kids enjoyed it!!

Thanks for a awesome evening. I'm in town alot so after a long day at the convention hall it's nice to sit down and enjoy a slice and a beer with friends. I hope that Y'all will always be there. And I know she was hurt with her foot but wow what an amazing woman. She was very nice. Hope she gets better soon. Sorry forgot her name but. But once I come agian and see her I promise to remember. Thanks to everyone and the cooks as well

Great pizza, very tasty sauce, cheese, and crust. I think they brush on butter on the crust or maybe I'm losing my mind but it was very good. I had a slice of pep and loaded potato. Both were delicious, I forgot to take a pic of the pep because I was hungry.
Good food, beer and nice place to eat. Even a pacman arcade!

Absolutely delicious. Love the atmosphere and the foods. The waiter was very nice and the food was amazing. I really enjoyed the fact that you can order a single slice and have it made anyway you like. Also, they have amazing house vinegrett. I totally recommend this place. Try the pesto sauce on any pizza.
Decent beer selection on tap and a nice menu. I had the Strom and it was very good. It was quiet when I was here, but could be a cool hangout for a group

Good pizza, long wait for 2 slices of pizza. Slices were large, thin crust, tasty. We we're not expecting to have to wait so long for take-out. Interesting area, reminiscent of areas in old European cites like Florence. Would definitely go back to dine in and have a couple of drinks!

I  saw an guest coming back to my work place , and they had a box of pizza, I ask them where ? did you get that cause I 'm a big pizza fan, he said slice, so I called and to my surprise the owner brought me an free pizza, that was a few month's ago that was so kind, at the time I did'nt know he was the owner, he refuse my tip and said no I' m the owner thank you , so tonight a guest was asking about pasta dinners I called and Daniel said that you serve that as well, so some of my guest will be dinning tonight God Bless YOU all. From Hgi. Downtown Atlanta.
Great!!!!!
Nice atmosphere, good New York style pizza, and the Beer is reasonably priced as well!
Expensive bar atmosphere
Great made to order pizza and wonderful drinks.
Love the pizza
Best calzones ever! Friendly staff. Cool industrial setting with lots of character.
Great food and atmosphere!
Great spot to grab a slice of pizza and an adult beverage! Also great for pre-game food and beverages before games at MBS or Philips!

Food was great! Lasagna was so tasty! Definitely recommend! Friendly waiter. The place is kinda off from the main streets. We walked couple of blocks away passing this restaurant. Their signs were not visible.
This is my favorite pizza place in Atlanta! The decor is great and fits in with the area. The food is really good, as are the drinks. The staff is also really friendly.
Price was awesome, lasagna and muffalattas were delicious.
Amazing pizza and salads.  Tasty ingredients and friendly service.
Good small place to grab a pizza downtown Atlanta.
Great food and service😁
Great Pizza
'Nice pizza'

Out of town to visit six flags and asked an officer what's the best pizza place nearby?? Just as I suspected turns out cops are always honest!!! I second his opinion in being the best in the area!!!  Plus it's always an added feel good when the owner comes bus your table and is shaking hands with the customers on their way out!!!  If ever in the area this place is an swank place to get some really awesome pizza and a craft 16oz'er 😜😋😎🍕🍻👍👍
The chicken parm is FREAKING UH-MAZING. Can't wait to go back again!

I particularly enjoyed the lasagna.  Pizza and salads are also recommended.  A favorite of local University  students.  When the weather is pleasant, an outdoor table on a quiet shaded sidewalk can't be beat.  Find it in the heart of the historic Fairlie-Poplar district at the corner of Fairlie and Poplar.
